newsitem.title: USA: Avid stock jumps as Q1 tops expectations.
newsitem.headline: Avid stock jumps as Q1 tops expectations.

text.p: Shares of Avid Technology Inc on Thursday jumped about 26 percent after the company's first-quarter earnings shattered Wall Street expectations.
Avid jumped four points to 19 in afternoon trading, with almost 2.4 million shares traded, five times its normal trading volume.

Avid, which produces digital video and audio editing systems, posted first-quarter earnings of $0.08 a share, compared with a loss of $1.08 a share in the same period last year. Last year's first-quarter results included $20.2 million in pretax charges.
On a consensus basis, analysts expected Avid to post a loss of $0.09 a share, with estimates ranging from a loss of $0.07 a share to a loss of $0.17 a share, according to First Call.

"Their numbers were obviously better than expected. The gross margins were higher than expected, and the company controlled operating expenses better than expected," said Edgar Bierdeman, an analyst with Dakin Securities.
"The second quarter could be better, as well, given the expense control we've seen," Bierdeman said.
Avid's first-quarter gross margins were 48.1 percent, better than 46.3 percent analysts said they had expected.
Avid's strong first-quarter results added to the positive buzz about the Tewksbury, Mass.-based company.
Last month, Intel Corp said it would invest $14.75 million in Avid as part of a plan to bring Avid's high-quality video editing products to a wider audience.
